Name: Pebble
Description: Pebble, perhaps used for grinding, found in a tomb at Tarkhan, a rich cemetery from the time of the first recorded unification of Egypt, around 3000 BC. The grave measured 28 by 55 by 60 inches, containing a contracted body, with head to the south, and face turned facing west. The other grave goods included a siltstone cosmetic palette, for grinding eyepaint, some malachite, a green copper ore used for eyepaint, and an armlet and beads, as well as the stone vessel Dublin NMI 1913:277.
